summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. It submits a joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire for the court's review, notes areas of disagreement between the prosecution and defense, and requests the documents be filed under seal to avoid prejudicial media coverage.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter is addressed to her and submits joint proposals for jury selection.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The document pertains to jury selection procedures for her trial.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who respectfully submitted the letter to the court.

connections.description: Williams, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the prosecution against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Court Order on Jury Selection
events.description: The Court issued an order (Docket No. 330) regarding procedures for the upcoming trial, prompting the parties to confer and submit proposed jury selection materials.

events.title: Submission of Joint Jury Proposals
events.description: The Government, on behalf of the parties, submitted a joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire to Judge Nathan, highlighting areas of disagreement between prosecution and defense.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case collaborated on but disagreed on specific points in proposed jury selection documents.
The defense requested that the juror questionnaire and voir dire questions be filed under seal to prevent media influence on the jury pool, a request to which the prosecution consented.
The document is a procedural filing from October 2021, showing the pre-trial preparations underway for Maxwell's criminal trial.

Areas of disagreement between the Government and defense on jury selection are indicated by colored text (green for defense proposals objected to by Government, purple for Government proposals objected to by defense).
